Introduction

Experienced Scrum Product Owner focused on building great software to solve business challenges the right way. My experience to date mostly involves building highly scalable, high performance Django applications and WordPress platforms.

Notable Projects

Pronto Dashboard

Integrated Marketing Platform

Product Owner - December 2013 – Present

app.prontomarketing.com

As a Marketing Agency with 1,000+ clients, Pronto faced a particular issue of scaling our many services to the next level. This project started with building out an Customer Portal system with integrations to our billing system (Zuora), support system Zendesk, and a custom Service Sign Up & Onboarding system with a dynamic form wizard. We also integrated with our website development platform, WordPress Multisite, to bring core customer data together into the same application.

From there we broke ground into new territority to better server our customers with marketing performance dashboards for Website Traffic, Keyword Tracking, Competitor Tracking, & Web Leads. This involved a whole new set of integrations to Google Analytics, Moz, and Authority Labs Partner API.

Phoenix Platform

High Performance WordPress

Product Owner - January 2013 – Present

www.prontomarketing.com

Pronto needed a website platform to build and maintain 1,000s of unique websties for their customers to scale. Key goals for this project invcluded mobile friendliness (responsive), ease of site development, maintainability, flexibility, and performance. The platform now has more than 700 websites, page load times of < 2s, 99.996% uptime on less than $1,000/m infrastructure costs. We used top tier technologies such as Varnish, Nginx, HHVM, Memcached deployed on AWS using Route 53, Ec2, Elasticache, & RDS.

Experience

Platform & Development Lead

Pronto Marketing

December 2010 – Present

www.prontomarketing.com

Something about manager and leader of scrum team.

Account Manager

OrderWork Ltd

August 2009 – August 2010

My position as Account Manager at OrderWork was a great learning experience for me while living in London. OrderWork was a young and growing company at the time that needed hands on Account Managers to help delivering great service to their corporate clients and grow their base of service providers. Responsibilities included:

  • Design processes and procedures to build successful relationships with clients.
  • Coordinate client meetings and visits to effectively grow market share within accounts
  • Conduct customer training meetings with clients – particularly with new clients.
  • Allocate and track work using the administration tools in the OrderWork portal
  • Recruit, vet and approve service partners (including face-to-face interviews).
  • Produce statistical reports and analysis to provide customer insights as required.
